title: Special traffic and security plan announced for exposition of Sacred Relics from India
byline: Sri Lanka Police have announced extensive security arrangements and a special traffic management plan ahead of the exposition of Sacred Relics brought from India, scheduled to be held at the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple from 05 February, 2026.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of shower will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Hambanthota district, today (02), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ becomes first K-Pop Grammy winner ever
byline: Golden, the inescapable hit from the movie KPop Demon Hunters, has become the first ever K-Pop song to win a Grammy Award.

title: Steven Spielberg achieves EGOT status with Grammy win for ‘Music by John Williams’
byline: The filmmaker achieved EGOT status, winning a Grammy Award in the best music film category for the documentary “Music by John Williams,” a tribute to his longtime collaborator and the composer behind some of cinema’s most enduring scores.

title: GMOA to intensify trade union action from today
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) says it will intensify its ongoing trade union action from this morning (02), following a lack of response from relevant authorizes regarding several of their key demands.

title: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others further remanded
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and six other individuals, have been further remanded until 09 February, 2026 by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court.

title: Couple arrested with ‘Ice’ worth Rs. 8 million in Puttalam
byline: A married couple has been arrested yesterday (01) in a raid conducted by the Narcotics Control Unit of the Puttalam Police for possession of 524 grams of Crystal Methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’).

title: Five-year-old boy detained by ICE has returned to Minnesota, lawmaker says
byline: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father have returned to their home in a Minneapolis suburb after being detained by U.S. immigration officers and held at a detention facility in Texas, a lawmaker said on Sunday.

title: Dalai Lama wins first Grammy, cites shared universal responsibility
byline: The Dalai Lama — one of the world’s most revered spiritual voices — has added an unexpected new honour to his life of accolades, winning his first Grammy Award at the age of 90.

title: SC dismisses FR petitions challenging ASP promotions in 2020
byline: The Supreme Court has decided to dismiss seven Fundamental Rights (FR) petitions filed by 145 Chief Inspectors of Police who challenged the promotions to the rank of Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) based on applications called for in 2020.

title: AG’s Department Legal Officers express concern over baseless allegations on Attorney General
byline: The Attorney General’s Department Legal Officers’ Association has expressed concern over the circulation of unfounded and baseless personal attacks directed at the Attorney General (AG), Parinda Ranasinghe (Jnr), PC, and officers of the Attorney General’s Department in the discharge of their official duties.

title: Police Inspector and Constable arrested over missing firearm
byline: A Police Inspector and a Police Constable have been arrested in connection with the disappearance of a pistol and a magazine containing 10 rounds of ammunition from the Matugama Police Station, police said.

title: Son of Norway’s crown princess to go on trial on rape and other charges
byline: The eldest son of Norway’s crown princess will go on trial Tuesday on multiple charges including rape in a high-profile case that has been an embarrassment to the royal family.

title: Rs. 3 billion drug haul seized from fishing boat sent to Govt Analyst
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (02) ordered that the drug stock worth over Rs. 03 billion, recently seized by the Sri Lanka Navy and brought to Dikkowita Fisheries Harbour, be referred to the Government Analyst for examination and to call for an analytical report.

title: Minister inspects Kotikambokka Vein Quartz Deposit, orders measures to prevent illegal mining
byline: The Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, Sunil Handunnetti, conducted a field inspection yesterday (01) at the Kotikambokka Vein Quartz Deposit in the Monaragala District, where mining activities are currently suspended.

title: STF officer commits suicide with service firearm
byline: An officer attached to the Special Task Force (STF) camp in Katukurunda, Kalutara, has committed suicide by shooting himself with his service firearm, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Grammys 2026 full winners list: Bad Bunny, Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish among top winners
byline: The 68th Grammy Awards have taken place in Los Angeles, with Kendrick Lamar the night’s biggest winner for the second year in a row.

title: School dev. officers stage protest over unaddressed demands
byline: A protest organized by the School Development Officers’ Association commenced this morning (02) in front of the Presidential Secretariat, citing the lack of solutions to their long-standing grievances.

title: NPP’s Chinthaka Hewapathirana elected new Chairman of Weligama PS
byline: Chinthaka Hewapathirana of the National People’s Power (NPP) has been elected as the new Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: ‘Victory is certain’: Vijay to party supporters as TVK marks 3rd anniversary
byline: Actor Vijay’s Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam party marks its 3rd anniversary, vowing to capture power in the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections through a people’s movement.

title: Bangladesh court sentences Sheikh Hasina to 10 years in jail in corruption cases
byline: A Bangladesh court on Monday sentenced deposed Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to 10 years in jail in two separate corruption cases related to alleged irregularities in allocations of land in a government housing project.

title: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish use Grammy stage to call out Trump’s anti-immigrant crackdown
byline: American singer Billie Eilish used her Grammy acceptance speech on Monday to call out Donald Trump administration’s anti-immigrant crackdown, after Puerto Rican rapper-singer Bad Bunny did the same.

title: Court orders CID to arrest Chamal Rajapaksa’s youngest son Shamindra Rajapaksa who is currently in US
byline: The Colombo Fort Magistrate orders the CID to arrest Shamindra Rajapaksa, the youngest son of former Minister Chamal Rajapaksa who is currently in the US and to produce him before court.

title: Donald Trump threatens to “sue” Trevor Noah after 2026 Grammys Epstein joke
byline: US President Donald Trump has taken to social media to denounce the Grammys show and take aim at host Trevor Noah, after the last awards were handed out Sunday night.

title: Three nabbed with turtle meat and eggs in Mannar
byline: Three individuals have been arrested by the Sri Lanka Navy with 17kg of turtle meat, 39 turtle eggs and a dinghy, during a search operation conducted in the Nachchikuda beach area of Mannar.

title: Gold prices drop by Rs. 12,000
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have reduced considerably, in line with a reduction in the global market.

title: Israel reopens Gaza’s Rafah border crossing to Egypt, with limits
byline: Israel reopened the border between Gaza and Egypt on Monday for people on foot, a move that would allow Palestinians to leave the enclave and let back in those who want to return after fleeing Israel’s war in the enclave.

title: Chaminda Kularatne arrives at Bribery Commission to lodge a complaint against Speaker Wickramaratne
byline: The suspended Deputy Secretary General of Parliament and Chief of Staff, Chaminda Kularatne has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to lodge a complaint.

title: Demonstration held in Nedunkerny calling for halt to Kivul Oya Reservoir Project
byline: A group of people staged a protest today (02) in Nedunkerny, demanding that the proposed ‘Kivul Oya Reservoir Project’, which is expected to be launched to provide irrigation facilities for farming to the residents of Welioya and Northern Province, be halted.

title: Woman dies in road accident in Anuradhapura
byline: A woman has died in a road accident that occurred at the Matale Junction in Anuradhapura this afternoon (02), police stated.

title: Indian tax on animal imports spells setback for billionaire Ambani family’s zoo
byline: India’s budget introduced a customs duty of 30% on imports of animals and birds from Monday, a move set to boost expenses for the nation’s most prominent zoo, run by the family of Asia’s richest man, Mukesh Ambani.

title: SLBFE conducts awareness programs to combat foreign employment scams
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has decided to conduct a series of awareness programs for police officers, focusing on anti-human trafficking laws, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment Act, and effective investigative techniques.

title: A/L 2025: Biosystems Technology practical exam to begin on Feb. 7
byline: The practical examination for Biosystems Technology subject for the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will commence on February 7, the Department of Examinations has announced.

title: China executes four more Myanmar mafia members
byline: China has executed four members of the Bai family mafia, one of the notorious dynasties that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

title: CID ordered to arrest Chamal Rajapaksa’s son Shamindra who is currently in US
byline: The Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court has ordered the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to arrest Shamindra Rajapaksa, the youngest son of former Minister Chamal Rajapaksa who is currently in the United States.

title: Oracle shares fall as investors assess up to $50 billion AI funding plan
byline: Oracle shares fell about 4 per cent in premarket trading on Monday, after it outlined plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year to expand its cloud infrastructure, fueling investor concerns about its rising debt load.

title: Special bus service for devotees visiting Gangaramaya Temple for exposition of sacred relics
byline: A special bus service has been arranged for devotees visiting the Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, for the exposition of the sacred bodily relics to be brought from Gujarat India.

title: Exams Dept. issues special notice on O/L admission cards
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations has issued a special notice regarding the downloading and modification of admission cards for the G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination 2025 (2026).

title: Fisheries Minister condemns Indian Coast Guard attack on Sri Lankan fishermen
byline: Strong objections are being raised against an attack carried out by Indian Coast Guard officers on a group of Sri Lankan fishermen based on false allegations, the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources, Ramalingam Chandrasekar stated.

title: Sajith urges Govt to absorb Development Officers into Teacher Service
byline: The Leader of the Opposition, Sajith Premadasa has called on the government to recruit Development Officers into the Teacher Service.

title: Chaminda Kularatne lodges complaint at Bribery Commission against Speaker
byline: The suspended Deputy Secretary General of Parliament and Chief of Staff, Chaminda Kularatne has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to lodge a complaint.

title: Peliyagoda Manning Market goes digital with new Online Payment System
byline: The Peliyagoda Manning Market has officially launched a digitalization initiative with a new online payment system.

title: 49 prisoners to be pardoned on Independence Day
byline: A decision has been taken to grant special presidential pardons to 49 prisoners in view of the 78th National Independence Day on February 4.

title: FM appreciates World Bank Executive Director’s backing for Sri Lanka’s development agenda
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath has expressed the country’s appreciation for the World Bank’s multisectoral partnership and its ongoing support for Sri Lanka’s development agenda in a post on X (formerly Twitter).

title: SJB activists express dissent amid Beruwala Urban Council controversy
byline: A heated situation arose at the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) party activists’ meeting in the Beruwala electorate.

title: UNP to launch new digital initiative to improve organizational operations
byline: The United National Party (UNP) will officially launch its new digital initiative at the party headquarters in Sirikotha on Wednesday (04).

title: Businessman arrested at BIA for smuggling Rs. 24 million in foreign currency
byline: An individual has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle a large quantity of foreign currency into Sri Lanka.

title: Special shuttle service for devotees visiting Gangaramaya for sacred relics exposition
byline: A special shuttle bus service has been arranged for devotees visiting the Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, for the exposition of the sacred bodily relics to be brought from Gujarat India.

title: Sri Lanka squad for T20 World Cup 2026 announced
byline: Sri Lanka have announced their 15-member squad for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, set to be played in Sri Lanka and India.

title: Iran President orders nuclear talks with US as Trump hopeful of deal
byline: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has ordered the start of nuclear talks with the United States, local media said Monday, after US leader Donald Trump said he was hopeful of a deal to avert military action against the Islamic Republic.

title: Trump says US and India have agreed to trade deal, tariffs will be reduced from 25% to 18%
byline: US President Donald Trump says the United States and India have agreed to a trade deal.

title: 194kg of cannabis intended to be smuggled to Sri Lanka seized in Tamil Nadu
byline: A total of 194 kg of cannabis intended to be smuggled to Sri Lanka have been seized by the Ramanathapuram Q-Branch police in Tamil Nadu.
